clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Red Meat and Whole-grains Intake on the Colonic Mucosal Barrier
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Red Meat and Whole-grains Intake on the Colonic Mucus' Thickness, Colonic MUC-2 Expression Rate and the Inflammatory Markers in the Blood.

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the impact of red meat and whole-grain intake on the colonic mucosal barrier and the dietary impact of these groups on the induced low-grade inflammation

primary_outcome.description: We will evaluate the thickness of the inner mucus layer in 38 biopsies of subjects, at the upper and lower quartiles of red meat and whole-grain consumption

secondary_outcome.description: Using real time PCR, we will examine the association between the expression of mucin 2 gene in relation to red meat and whole grain fiber intake

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory markers in blood (IL-1beta, IL-4, IL-6, IL-10, Hs-CRP, and TNF-alfa)
secondary_outcome.description: These markers will be evaluated in relation to red meat and whole-grain intake

arm_group.description: Consists of subjects referred to a colonoscopy between June 1, 2017, and December 1, 2019, in the hospital of Southern Denmark

biospec_descr.textblock:
- Fecal samples in DNA- stabilizing medium
- Biopsies from the colon sigmoideum immediately frozen in nitrogen liquid
- Biopsies from the colon sigmoideum in RNAlater, and frozen under -80 degree celsius
- Blood samples
- Spot-urine

study_pop.textblock: Subjects referred to a colonoscopy in the Hospital of Southern Denmark, and who met the eligibility criteria of this study were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects referred to a colonoscopy in the Hospital of Southern Denmark
- Subjects able to read and understand Danish
- Mentally habile subjects
- Subjects who accept to be a part of the project
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of active cancer
- A recent colonoscopy (less than 3 months ago )
- Anamnesis of Inflammatory bowel diseases.
